# Description of DataSchema variable

The description of harmonised variable is the following:
  
* Name: `height`
* Label: `height of the participant`
* Type of variable: `countinous`
* Missings: 
    + `991 = CAPI/interviewer error`
    + `992 = Impute`
    + `993 = Disable to measure`
    + `994 = Not attempt/not done`
    + `995 = Does not answer`
    + `996 = Not applicable`
    + `997 = Refuse`
    + `998 = Do not know`
    + `999 = Missing`
* Comments: `Antropomeric measure for height should be measured in centimeters.`

# Data process

### 10/66 - Cuba - Wave 1 

#### Study-specific variables

The study-specific variable elected to be harmonised is:

* Name: `HEIGHT`
* Label: `height (cms)`
* Type of variable: `countinous`


```{r assign_cuba1}
opal.assign.table.tibble(o, 't1066_cuba_w1_heig','10-66.1066-Cuba-Baseline',
                         variables=list('HEIGHT'), missings = TRUE)
```

```{r local_cuba1}
t1066_cuba_w1_heig <- opal.execute(o,'t1066_cuba_w1_heig')
Continuous_summary(var = t1066_cuba_w1_heig$HEIGHT, missing_values = NA)
ggplot(t1066_cuba_w1_heig, aes(HEIGHT)) + geom_histogram(stat="count", fill="steelblue") + xlab("Height") + ylab("Frequency") + xlim(100,200)
```

#### Harmonisation algorithm
The harmonized variable is the same than the study-specific variable, but the missing values have to be car::recoded as follows:

* `NA into 999`

R code of the ALGORITHM:

```{r harmo_cuba1}
t1066_ds_cuba_w1 <- tibble(id=t1066_cuba_w1_heig$id)
t1066_ds_cuba_w1$height <- car::recode(t1066_cuba_w1_heig$HEIGHT, "NA=999")
t1066_ds_cuba_w1$height <- labelled(t1066_ds_cuba_w1$height, labels = c("Missing"=999, "Do not know"=998, "Refuse"=997, "Not attempt not done"=994, "Does not answer"=995,  "Not applicable"=996, "Disable to measure"=993, "Impute"=992, "CAPI interviewer error"=991))
```

#### Statistics of the new harmonised variable
```{r descript_cuba1}
Continuous_summary(var = t1066_ds_cuba_w1$height, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))
ggplot(t1066_ds_cuba_w1, aes(height)) + geom_histogram(stat="count", fill="steelblue") + xlab("height") + ylab("Frequency") + xlim(100,200) 
```

#### Validation
```{r crosstabulation_cuba1}
```
